Key Match Events: Quinton de Kock's blistering knock nearly handed South Africa victory over Zimbabwe before rain played spoilsport.
South Africa were comfortably chasing a reduced target of 64 off seven overs, after the match was already reduced to nine overs per side due to rain.
De Kock smashed 23 in the first over alone.
De Kock accelerated to a brutal 18-ball 47 before the next interruption after three overs proved to be the final one.
Zimbabwe lost openers Craig Ervine (2) and Regis Chakabva (8) in the powerplay and were left reeling at 12-3 before the end of the third over.
Sikandar Raza fell for a duck to Lungi Ngidi.
Sean Williams was run out (1) in the next over.
The 53-run partnership between Wessly Madhevere and Milton Shumba brought some much-needed stability to a chaotic Zimbabwe innings.
Madhevere top-scored with an unbeaten 35 off 17 while Shumba added 18 before being dismissed on the last ball of the innings.
Zimbabwe were awarded five penalty runs after the ball rolled into De Kock's wicketkeeping glove on the field.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play, reducing the game to 20 overs per side.
